problem.markdown:
>>A system goes from state A to state B and then returns to state A. If the process from state A to state B is a quasi-static process, the returning process from state B to state A must also be a quasi-static process.<< ( ) True (x) False
[explanation] A system can go from one state to another state by a quasi-static or a non quasi-static process. This has no relation to previous states or processes of system. [explanation]
problem.p: A system goes from state A to state B and then returns to state A. If the process from state A to state B is a quasi-static process, the returning process from state B to state A must also be a quasi-static process.

choicegroup.label: A system goes from state A to state B and then returns to state A. If the process from state A to state B is a quasi-static process, the returning process from state B to state A must also be a quasi-static process.

div.p: A system can go from one state to another state by a quasi-static or a non quasi-static process. This has no relation to previous states or processes of system.
